name: Classic Christians
description: A monthly fellowship group for seniors.
body_content: Every month, the retired people at Bible Baptist get together at a local restaurant (check here for info) and just spend some time swapping stories and fellowship.  Sometimes, we travel as far away as Shelbyville or Effingham, but we always have a good time.
meeting_time: First Tuesday of every month at 5:30pm.
leader_bio: Mike Drummond is a member of Bible Baptist.  He enjoys restoring classic cars and woodworking.

name: MACHS
description: MACHS is a co-op for homeschool families.  Every other week we meet together and split up into classes. MACHS has helped over 40 families in it's first year.
body_content: MACHS stands for Mattoon Area Christian Homeschoolers.  Started by Amanda Hayden (our pastor's wife) Machs is a co-op that meets at the church every other Monday. We have classes for kids of all ages.
meeting_time: Every other Monday from 9:00 AM to noon
leader_bio: Amanda Hayden is a former school teacher who now is a homemaker, pastor's wife, and homeschool mom.  She also leads the Mattoon Area Christian Homeschooler's Co-op.

name: Mother's of Mattoon
description:
A fellowship group for mothers of school aged children."
group: "Mothers of school aged children.
body_content:
Mothers of Mattoon is a group for mothers of school aged children. Once a month, the M.o.M. group gets together for an meeting that includes:


### A fun activity

The M.o.M. group has done everything from crafts to cooking to painting.  They've had special speakers come in to talk about many different subjects.

### Mentoring

The M.o.M. group has several mentors.  Godly ladies who have already mothered their children.  These ladies share the lesson at each meeting and are available for help.

### Food

Every M.o.M. meeting includes some kind of food.

### Child Care

Free child care is provided at each meeting.

## Annual Activities

Every year, the M.o.M. group puts on several activities:

### The M.o.M. Consignment Sale

Every spring and fall, the M.o.M. group does a consignment sale.  This helps mothers two ways:

1. It helps our moms make a little money and get rid of clutter.  90% of the sale price goes back to the mothers.
2. It helps both our moms and other local moms find affordable used closed for their families.  

The M.o.M. consignment sale is usually attended by several hundred people and has been steadily growing for years.

### The M.o.M. Craft fair

Every winter, before Christmas, our ladies host a craft fair.  Last year, nearly a dozen vendors presented their crafts.
meeting_time: First Monday of the month at 6:30 p.m.
leader_bio: Amanda Hayden is a former school teacher who now is a homemaker, pastor's wife, and homeschool mom.  She also leads the Mattoon Area Christian Homeschooler's Co-op.
